channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- Sterling Secure Proxy
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- Sterling Secure Proxy

item.title: CVE-2022-34362|2024-08-03T09:07:16.143Z -- ibm -- sterling%20secure%20proxy
item.description: IBM Sterling Secure Proxy 6.0.3 is vulnerable to HTTP header injection, caused by improper validation of input by the HOST headers. This could allow an attacker to conduct various attacks against the vulnerable system, including cross-site scripting, cache poisoning or session hijacking. IBM X-Force ID: 230523.

item.title: CVE-2022-22336|2024-08-03T03:07:50.287Z -- ibm -- sterling%20secure%20proxy
item.description: IBM Sterling External Authentication Server and IBM Sterling Secure Proxy 6.0.3.0, 6.0.2.0, and 3.4.3.2 could allow a remote user to consume resources causing a denial of service due to a resource leak. IBM X-Force ID: 219395.

item.title: CVE-2022-22333|2024-08-03T03:07:50.401Z -- ibm -- sterling%20secure%20proxy
item.description: IBM Sterling Secure Proxy 6.0.3.0, 6.0.2.0, and 3.4.3.2 and IBM Sterling External Authentication Server are vulnerable a buffer overflow, due to the Jetty based GUI in the Secure Zone not properly validating the sizes of the form content and/or HTTP headers submitted. A local attacker positioned inside the Secure Zone could submit a specially crafted HTTP request to disrupt service. IBM X-Force ID: 219133.

item.title: CVE-2022-34361|2024-08-03T09:07:16.126Z -- ibm -- sterling%20secure%20proxy
item.description: IBM Sterling Secure Proxy 6.0.3 uses weaker than expected cryptographic algorithms that could allow an attacker to decrypt highly sensitive information. IBM X-Force ID: 230522.
